intro: Sida debilis, commonly known as weak sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white and are clustered in small inflorescences. Sida debilis is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
